__TOC__


* Use lspci to find the network adapter and graphics card ("VGA compatible controller" usually)
* Download the latest release from <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/testing/]]</nowiki>.
* system, administration, USB startup disk creator
* click "other", find the downloaded ISO
* Insert a USB stick. THIS WILL BE ERASED.
* click "format" on the drive (e.g. sdc) not partition (e.g. sdc1)
* click on partition and "make startup disk"
* Boot with this stick
* "Try Ubuntu without making changes"
* Attempt to launch Firefox and browse to launchpad.net
* Put the results here, organized by the hardware as reported by lspci
* If something goes wrong, discuss in the forums and try to put together a solid bug report
